intro: Cleyera siphilitica, commonly known as the small-leaf cleyera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly found in areas of Georgia, South Carolina, and Florida. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and thickets. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to support local wildlife.
